meanings.definition: To arrange or present in a series.
meanings.sent1: I will serialise the story by putting the events in order.
meanings.sent2: She likes to serialise her drawings to show the progression of her art.
meanings.sent3: The teacher decided to serialise the lesson plan for better understanding.
meanings.sent4: He managed to serialise the tasks, making the workload more manageable.
meanings.sent5: Serialising the tasks made it easier to track their completion.

meanings.definition: To publish or broadcast in installments.
meanings.sent1: The author will serialise the novel in weekly chapters.
meanings.sent2: They plan to serialise the documentary over several episodes.
meanings.sent3: The radio station will serialise the drama for the listeners' enjoyment.
meanings.sent4: She decided to serialise her podcast to keep the audience engaged.
meanings.sent5: Serialising the show created anticipation for the next episode.

meanings.definition: To convert data into a series of bits for transmission.
meanings.sent1: The computer will serialise the information before sending it.
meanings.sent2: It is important to serialise the data accurately to avoid errors.
meanings.sent3: The scientist had to serialise the findings before sharing them.
meanings.sent4: The software can serialise the files quickly for efficient transfer.
meanings.sent5: Serialising the files ensures they are transmitted correctly.
